thread.title: Collins hints at 2016 plan for Mets’ young superstar hurlers
thread.title_full: Collins hints at 2016 plan for Mets’ young superstar hurlers | New York Post

author: Mike Puma
title: Collins hints at 2016 plan for Mets’ young superstar hurlers
text:
CHICAGO — Work now, rest later.
As the Mets’ young starting pitchers push forward in October and reach new workload thresholds, pitching coach Dan Warthen said there are possible plans to curtail Matt Harvey, Jacob deGrom and Noah Syndergaard next spring.
“They wouldn’t miss any starts [in April], but we may wait until later in spring training for them to start throwing,” Warthen told The Post before the Mets’ 5-2 victory over the Cubs in Game 3 of the NLCS on Tuesday night at Wrigley Field.
Of the three, only Syndergaard hasn’t surpassed 200 innings combined between the regular season and postseason, but the rookie could reach that plateau if the Mets advance to the World Series.
Harvey, who is bruised and swollen near his right shoulder after getting hit with a line drive in Game 1, threw off flat ground and said he is ready for a potential Game 5 start on Thursday.
But manager Terry Collins said the Mets are still monitoring the situation.
“I was surprised at how swelled up it was [Monday],” Collins said, adding that Bartolo Colon and Jon Niese are potential alternatives.
